notes: Those in unpaid leave status before termination were returned to unpaid leave status

This number excludes probationary employees who were terminated in individualized actions based on their performance or conduct, and therefore excludes individuals who do not meet the definition of “Affected Probationary Employees” in paragraph 10(c) of the Temporary Restraining Order (TRO) entered in this case on March 13, 2025.

13 additional probationary employees who were terminated are not included because they are not defined as "affected probationary employees." Two were terminated based on individualized performance-based determinations, eight had their terminations rescinded before issuance of the TRO, two resigned, and one accepted the Deferred Resignation Program.
Each employee who does not submit a resignation will be placed on active duty beginning Thursday, March 20, 2025
Includes 1,303 competitive service appointments during their probationary periods and 409 excepted service appointments during their trial periods.
The Department does not intend to reinstate two individuals, both of whom qualify for exclusions from the TRO
Unclear whether these employees are on administrative leave.

Employees were previously on intermittent work schedules (non-pay status) at the time of their release and are being reinstated and returned into intermittent non-pay status (not on administrative leave).
2 of these employees declined to be reinstated.
Not sure why there are more reinstated than terminated
